Package game

Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
game.Polygon
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ground, Level.Obstacle, Level.Platform, Player
class Polygon extends Object
CLASS: Polygon DESCRIPTION: A polygon is a sequence of points in space defined by a set of such points, an offset, and a rotation. The offset is the distance between the origin and the center of the shape. The rotation is measured in degrees, 0-360. USAGE: You are intended to instantiate this class with a set of points that forever defines its shape, and then modify it by repositioning and rotating that shape. In defining the shape, the relative positions of the points you provide are used, in other words: {(0,1),(1,1),(1,0)} is the same shape as {(9,10),(10,10),(10,9)}. NOTE: You don't need to worry about the "magic math" details.

    • collides

      public boolean collides(Polygon other)
      Checks if the current object collides with another Polygon object by checking if the current object contains any of the points in other or if other contains any of the points of the current object.
      Parameters:
      other - the Polygon object to check
      Returns:
      true if current object hits other, false otherwise.

    • placeOnGround

      public void placeOnGround()
      Sets the current object's rotation to 0 and adjust's its y-value such that its lowest point is on the ground.

    • placeOn

      public void placeOn(Polygon other)
      Sets the current object's rotation to 0 and adjust's its y-value such that its lowest point is on top of other.
      Parameters:
      other - the object upon which the current object is placed
